wiki.content:
"One in Ten" is a single by UB40 released in 1981 on their second album Present Arms. It reached No. 7 on the UK singles charts.
 
 One in Ten is a reference to the number of unemployed in the UK at that time.
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "One in Ten" is a single by UB40 released in 1981 on their second album Present Arms. It reached No. 7 on the UK singles charts.  One in Ten is a reference to the number of unemployed in the UK at that time.

track.name: One in Ten
comments: classic track
Hideous update.

I left school in the summer of 1981,this song was around that time and it felt like one in ten,you either could sign on and get dole,or like me too young to claim dole the careers service pushed towards Youth oppurtunities programmes,i ended up on one making double glazing earning £23.50 a week for fourty hours,my parents made it very clear if i didnt do this id be a homeless statistic.

Superb British reggae / roots. Very poignant. A very very good 'steppers' track, and the second half (instrumental) is wicked.  

They should re-release this, would get lots of cred'...
great great ....i love it ****
great tune

I AM THE ONE IN TEN!!!! NOBODY KNOWS ME BUT I`M ALWAYS THERE!!!:-)
LOVE UB40
Reminds me of how good they were before they started to endlessly churn out covers.
still sounds good
muito , mas muito very gooooooooood
"I have a one inch head!"
Takes me back!  I loved this period of time for UB40 songs.
rock maggie,rock  NOW 6 OUT OF10 IS UNEMPLOYED.....
From the Maggie Thatcher years but so true today.  This song in ageless
http://www.last.fm/group/THE+JOB+CENTRE+UNEMPLOYED+GROUP

This track was written 28 years ago,but still makes a lot of sense today.

Great track :)
good song
ein echt geiler song den man immer hören kann peace!
Ohh excellent song!!!!
Heading back that way again, unfortunately!
